comments.commentBody: Obama's silence is deafening.

replies.commentBody: We can only hope this happens before he does more damage to our country.

comments.commentBody: Trump is up to his armpits in Russia collusion and corruption. This will eventually bring down this pathetic administration.

If you ever watched Trumps show Celebrity Apprentice, you would know he condones lying. In fact, he fired celebrities for telling the truth because it was not "good business." The under lying consequences of everything he stated in his speech last night was really to benefit  corporations at the risk of peoples health.

replies.commentBody: It is a rehash of nothing there
tip of the iceberg

comments.commentBody: I read this article hoping that I might learn something. Instead, I was treated to a spurious list of enigmatic shreds presented as so-called evidence: "possible contacts...Trump associates...names of sources...identities of foreigners...alleged links...warning signs...suspected tampering...confirmed contacts of various kinds.  Good luck with all that.
Deep Throat shows up any day now

replies.commentBody: If they turn Mar-a-Lago into a prison camp for Trump and his convicted campaign and administration confederates, will they still let him cheat at golf?

comments.commentBody: If Hansel and Gretel had been titled Georgy and Olga maybe President Trump would have realized his predecessor might leave a trail of breadcrumbs. Or, perhaps there is no bread at Mar-a-Lago but only cake.

Americans have a right to know the truth about Trump. We have a right to see his taxes, and to know how much involvement he had with Russia before the election. We won't get honesty from Trump and his minions, but I hope that the truth soon becomes clear.
Finally we're getting real.
Please continue your excellent reporting.

replies.commentBody: i hope he finds himself behind bars...
There is also the possibility that he could be sent to a steel barred jail cell.
He should be sent to prison for treason.

comments.commentBody: Thank God! Obama exudes integrity and while he himself had nothing to gain by these actions, so committed is he and the people who worked for him, that they did what they felt they had to do to preserve our democracy and the authenticity of our elections.  This is an extraordinary act of patriotism on the part of the former President and I sincerely hope for the sake of the country, the imposter now residing in the White House will get sent back to his gilded birdcage on Fifth Avenue ASAP

replies.commentBody: Wishful thinking.
Well - that's the key isn't it?  If Republicans had an ounce of integrity, Donald Trump would not be President and we wouldn't be having this conversation.
Yes. To assert that Benghazi was worth 7 or 8 investigations but Russian interference in our election isn't worth any is cowardly, treasonous, and a profound disservice to every American citizen.

comments.commentBody: If Republicans have an ounce of integrity, they will investigate this potential juggernaut with at least the same assiduity, as inane as THAT was, with which they pursued Hillary's Benghazi and email hiccups.

replies.commentBody:
His speech and everything that comes out of the White House over the next three years will be a "created distraction" to redirect the focus of the press away from this long march to impeachment.

I hear the footsteps slowly beginning to gather and begin walking down the same path of justice that took out Richard Nixon.

It's not nice to fool Lady Liberty Donald.

This nation has shown the world how shallow is it's political IQ.

Let's hope the press doesn't play into Trump's game plan of controlling the evening news and news outlets begin to drop coverage of empty WH words and reports ONLY ON ACCOMPLISHMENTS.
To me, the speech, his voice sounded too calm, almost like he was medicated.

comments.commentBody: But the speech was so Presidential.  So sad.

replies.commentBody:
7 and counting I believe.

GOP collaborators must go down too. Word is 100M made it into their coffers. They also used same hacked data plus rigged machines as well as passed laws they bragged would guarantee a Republican was elected. Russia and FBI used by Russia and Chaffetz. The sewer is running deep in Congress. They must be removed too.
Good question.
Just finished Mafia State by Luke Harding - it was all there years ago.

comments.commentBody: How many of the recently assassinated Russians had damning testimony Moscow needed to silence?

replies.commentBody: Sergey Kislyak is still very much alive. You are confusing him with Vitaly Churkin, Russian ambassador to UN.

As pointed out by Janet, you seem to have mixed up Russian Ambassador Kislyak who is very much alive and who met with Michael Flynn and Vitaly Churkin, the long serving Russian Ambassador to the UN who recently died.
Vitaly Churkin Russian ambassador to the UN died.... not Kislyak.

comments.commentBody: it can't possibly be "just a coincidence" that Kislyak dropped dead of a heart attack just weeks after the Inauguration.

It's OUR government. We need to see this stuff as soon as possible. The old "National Security" line won't cut it--the secret's out, and we don't need the intervening episodes of Kabuki theatre. On with it.
His hair is on fire.  Bigly.

replies.commentBody: Because he's a coward. So worried about seeming unfair that he threw Hillary under the bus, by not speaking about the Russian influence before the election. Mr. Cool. Hah!

Obama never spoke that "Russians have no influence on the election"; on October 7, all 17 US intelligence agencies (who all work under the executive branch) put out a joint statement that they were “confident” in the knowledge that Russia intruded into “U.S. political organizations,” and certainly Obama was in on that statement being produced.  As to what you are likely referring to, Obama himself tried to calm the electorate specifically towards voting machine hacking, which even here we can see there is no evidence that this actually occurred, and only well after the election was it even found out that such attempts were made.   Specifically, he was talking about voting machine hacking favoring *Hillary*, which was in response to Trump's repeated claims that the election would be hacked.  Many of us thought it likely that Trump made these accusations specifically to cover up that he was aware of it going on in *his* favor - that the Russians actually did attempt it and that they were in contact with his campaign all but confirms this was the case.

except that it was widely discussed that the Russians were attempting to influence the election and Hillary even brought it up in the third debate.  Let's not rewrite history (more than it already is being done)

comments.commentBody: It's funny that Obama publicly spoke about Russians have no influence on the election before November. Why did he do that?

Where is this saga's Deep Throat? I hope he or she soon surfaces... Or may already be feeding the FBI information as we wait. It's just a matter of time. I recently read a quote: " There are three things that cannot remain hidden for long: the sun, the moon, and the truth."

replies.commentBody:
'Show your true patriotic colors for the good of the country!'

Wow. Really? Don't you think after collapsing the world economy and ruining the lives of almost 300 million ppl they would have shown for the good of the country between 2009-2016? Did they do ANYTHING but Obstruct? Ever once do anything for the people? No. Not once. They will not suddenly start to care about us now.

No. They got what they wanted. Absolute power to finally do everything they've wanted to do since Roosevelt. They will do all they can to keep that power by taking away ours to do anything about it.

This was the worst scenario that could have ever happened to us. And I do mean ever.

This is the definition of treason in the constitution
"Treason against the United States, shall consist only in levying War against them, or in adhering to their Enemies, giving them Aid and Comfort. No Person shall be convicted of Treason unless on the Testimony of two Witnesses to the same overt Act, or on Confession in open Court."
Not sure that Trump reaches that point. Try High Crimes and Misdemeanor
“The president, vice-president, and all civil officers of the United States, shall be removed from office on impeachment for, and conviction of treason, bribery, or other high crimes and misdemeanors.”

comments.commentBody:
Treason! That Congressional republicans are dragging their feet on a full independent investigation of such nefarious activities with our enemy is nothing less in the face of this evidence. Had this been a Democratic president, impeachment papers would have already been drawn up. Isn't that right, everyone?

Congress! You investigated "Benghazi" ad nauseum and with glee. That little incident PALES in comparison to consorting with our enemies to undermine the presidential election. Show your true patriotic colors for the good of the country! You guys don't even like Trump and investigating him will only enhance your longterm position with the American people. You have Pence to step in and protect your precious pro-business, anti-middle/working class, anti-environment, anti-civil rights, pro-evangelical agenda and as much as I abhor what he represents, I abhor a Russia-fawning traitor more. Otherwise, you too will go down in history as traitors and your time in power will be short-lived. Get cracking and NOW!

replies.commentBody: Oh for sure what else could it be?

I’ve been down the highway outside Aberdeen where his golf course is accessed and it is entirely possible he could easily manage who comes and goes in that situation. Security off the highway is immediately encountered.
Yes, golfing with Vlad so he could hack Podesta emails revealing the corrupt mess that the democratic party was. Sneaky Vlad!

comments.commentBody: Remember when Trump left campaign trail to visit golf course in Scotland? Was that trip a chance to meet Russian contacts?

What pops in me head silly as it is "Lost in Space Moment" all I could think was Anna danger, danger. I can't thank this man enough for protecting us.... again. He knew, I knew, many knew what was to come. I love you Barack Hussein Obama for keeping me safe & the majority as best you could.

replies.commentBody: Obama let the election play out, Trump won the electoral vote, so you call Obama a joke.  Huh.

If Obama had said anything after the election but before the inauguration publicly, it would have been a lightening rod.  He's smart enough to know that and also to realize that the truth would eventually be revealed.  Sometimes, time is on your side.

A) Of course, had he responded, in any way, to this he would have been attacked by the rabid right as trying to influence the election. B) What should he have done, declare war on Russia? Threaten them militarily? (see A) C) He made sure the evidence was preserved, given the high likelihood of it's 'disappearance' in a possible Trump administration, so that it could be analyzed and acted upon AFTER the election. Seems like a wise move to me.

comments.commentBody:
The cool, calm, cerebral Nobel Laureate president did nothing about the "act of War" (NY Times' words) perpetrated by Russia agains the United States - until after the election.

And what triggered the eureka moment for the Obama administration? Trump won. The word for Obama is "joke".

replies.commentBody:
Facts are not propaganda.

You see lies behind each Democrat word and that is to be unAmerican.

Just as to would be to see lies behind every Republican one.

Really, give it a rest.

what about all of the intelligence agencies of the other democracies - do you think they don't have evidence - particularly the European countries where Russia has been meddling for many years - educate yourself - either way you will learn
If DJT is free of guilt, then let's have an open investigation. And let's see his tax returns.

comments.commentBody: Obama administration rushed to preserve their propaganda against Trump implicating him in a Putin conspiracy and forward a new cold war.

replies.commentBody: They will be partisan. Isn't it obvious by now?
partisan--it's about access to money and power, not country

comments.commentBody: This is letting the world know the evidence was preserved and is there. Will the GOP be Americans or will they be partisan in our most threatening hour of need as a country?

replies.commentBody: Comey jumped the gun. Obama didn't.

'our new leaders don't even have to feed or house us.'

We are going back to the old 'Company Store' economy. Always worn down and in debt. I don't see the upside for them really. More $ in more hands gets more circulating to create commerce which eventually ends up back in the top guys pockets but just takes longer to get there. How is starving, dying, ill people good for anything? GOP gutting everything we need for healthy, prosperous lies by making us income streams.

Stay out of debt so they can't own you.
When Trump talked about unifying the country, he really meant that those who had opposed him and were still resisting him should just give up and join him and his supporters.

comments.commentBody:
When Trump starts a war to distract the people who's he supporting? Will it be the oil oligarchs (his Secretary of State), Putin, Al Assad, or all of them?

"Let's make good with Russia or they'll call in my debts by kneecapping the Presidency" is what Trump may be saying.

"Just give him time" looks like selling yourself down the river for corporate welfare and beefier oligarch rule. We're not slaves, we're serfs, old world style, our new leaders don't even have to feed or house us.
